title: Queensland Mechanics Turn to Skilled Migrants to Plug Labour Shortfall | ABC NEWS
description: More than half of Queensland’s automotive repair businesses say they’re struggling to find skilled workers – so much so, some are being forced to turn down work.  #ABC News Queensland by Stephen Clarke. title: Deadly varroa mite threatens half of Canberra’s beehives | ABC NEWS
description: Varroa mite is expected to infest ACT beehives and destroy about half of them over the next two years.  The resulting drop in pollinators will affect local fruit and vegetable production.  The ACT government is urging beekeepers to register hives and adopt strategies to help colonies survive. title: Min River wins overall Sydney-Hobart after protest against BNC | ABC NEWS
description: The overall result of the 80th Sydney to Hobart yacht race has been sensationally overturned due to a sail breach in the final stretch. NSW yacht Min River has claimed the Tattersall Cup after a protest was upheld against New Caledonian-flagged BNC. It marks the first time a double-handed yacht has taken the overall win in the race, and the first to do so with a female skipper. title: Passengers back in Australia after cruise chaos | ABC NEWS
description: About 80 passengers from the Coral Adventurer have been flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea. It is the same ship that left behind an 80-year-old woman on a Great Barrier Reef Island in October. German tourist Ursula Daus told the ABC she felt like her life was "in danger" as the ship hit the reef, and said she would "never, ever again" travel with the company. title: Hiker survives brown snake bite after multi-agency antivenom delivery | ABC NEWS
description: After being bitten by an eastern brown snake – of the most deadly in the world – Helen Worrell waited on the trail for just 50 minutes as emergency crews located and administered antivenom. She credits both emergency services and her family who was with her for saving her life. title: Flooding claims a life as deluge cuts north-west Queensland roads | ABC NEWS
description: After days of intense rainfall, finally the weather has eased across flood ravaged north-west Queensland. The reprieve has given graziers the chance to inspect the damage from the air and start to assess their losses. But for those on the tropical coast, there's no let-up with yet more torrential rain on the way. title: Clean-up begins after WA's north endures Tropical Cyclone Hayley | ABC NEWS
description: Residents and emergency services in Western Australia's north have begun the clean-up after severe Tropical Cyclone Hayley slammed into the remote area. Communities north of Broome copped the brunt of the storm with gusts reaching almost 160km an hour. title: Kakadu's spectacular scenery under threat as rising sea levels come at a cost to wetlands | ABC NEWS
description: Climate change is hitting the Northern Territory harder than most places in Australia.   Rising sea levels are changing the face of low-lying coastal wetlands and in the famous Kakadu National Park, it's estimated 80 per-cent of freshwater ecosystems will be converted to saltwater by the end of the century, changing the face of the park as we know it. Jayden O’Neil has this report for Stateline Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
